Intervention: CoQ10 100mg capsule combined with vitamin E 100 IU taken orally three times a day.
Eligibility: Hg > 11g/dl; supportive measures (erythropoietin, transfusion, iron therapy) should be used to help maintain Hgb levels
Women with primary diagnosis of cancer (arms)
• Anticipated adjuvant chemotherapy (neoadjuvant chemotherapy is excluded)
Recent involuntary weight loss (> 5% of body weight in the last 3 months)
The statin therapy - current or planned during the study. Below is a list of some statin medications commonly used. (Note: This guide is useful, not a complete list.)
Current or planned use of the following fatigue medications
- Corticosteroids (intermittent use in chemotherapy is allowed)
Amphetamines or other stimulants, including methylphenidate (Ritaline) or modafinil (Provigil)
• Pregnant women are excluded from participating in this study; a serum pregnancy test is required within one week of registration if the patient is a woman of childbearing age.
Anticoagulant treatment - current or planned during study (except for the maintenance of the catheter patent)
Results: Effects of coenzyme Q10 on fatigue (measured by POMS-F) 24 weeks after randomisation
POMS-F is the Pattern of mood states - fatigue scale. It ranges from 0 to 28; higher values indicate greater fatigue.
Arm/group title: arms 1 - CoQ10 and vitamin E
Description of the arm/group: CoQ10 100mg capsule combined with vitamin E 100 IU taken orally three times a day.
Unit of measurement: units on a scale 6.96 (0.71)
Title of the arm/group: arms 2 - Placebo and vitamin E
Description of the arm/group: Placebo-vitamin E 100 mg/day in 3 doses
Unit of measurement: units on a scale 8.33 (0.79)
